episodes.title: Lori Daybell Found Guilty! Cactus‑Bed to Baked‑Potato Comfort | Profiling Evil
episodes.description:
Lori Vallow Daybell has been found guilty of conspiracy to commit first‑degree murder in Arizona—buried under the scorching microscope of the Maricopa courtroom. But here’s the kicker: she wants out fast, trading her cactus‑bed jail environment for the baked‑potato comforts of Idaho prison. Let’s look at things unfolding in this Arizona Courtroom and explore Daybell’s almost comical urgency to push for sentencing. From the psychological reasons she’s itching to reclaim her prison persona and her stipulation of aggravating factors. Tune in for a blend of courtroom drama, criminal psychology, and just a pinch of humor—like an Arizona prickly pear. Lori begs for Idaho’s cheesy potato.

episodes.title: Lori Daybell, Why the Jeep Tint Matters | Profiling Evil
episodes.description:
In Day 3 of Lori Vallow Daybell’s Arizona trial, prosecutors zeroed in on the Jeep believed to be used in the attempted shooting of Brandon Boudreaux and Lori’s quiet involvement behind the scenes. The courtroom saw a parade of law enforcement officers, forensics experts, and digital analysts who tied together what might seem like mundane details—tint percentages, burner phone activation dates, cell tower locations—but each thread wove a clearer picture of how Brandon’s attempted murder was far from a random act. Lori continued her self-representation and cross-examined witnesses, raising questions about law enforcement’s methods and possible contamination of the crime scene. But as the day wore on, those challenges felt more like controlled chaos than legal precision. The timeline is tightening, and for all Lori’s maneuvering, it’s becoming harder to deny the data.

episodes.title: Can Lori Daybell Overturn Her Murder Convictions? | Profiling Evil
episodes.description:
Lori Vallow Daybell—the “Doomsday Mom” serving life in prison for murdering her two children and conspiring to kill Tammy Daybell—has just filed a sweeping appeal in the Idaho Supreme Court. On May 30, 2025, her appellate attorney filed a 64-page opening brief claiming five major legal errors in her trial. She also raises competency concerns and requests a public defender due to her limited resources. episodes.title: Classic Lori Daybell, Spiritual Spin or Sinister Strategy? | Profiling Evil
episodes.description:
Lori Vallow Daybell is once again representing herself in her Arizona conspiracy to commit murder trial—and what followed was pure, classic Lori. From Biblical allegories and spiritual declarations to courtroom chaos and sustained objection after objection, Lori’s opening statement said more about her psychology than her legal defense. In this episode, we break down how the prosecution built a methodical and damning case in just 26 minutes—and how Lori spent 16 minutes spinning doctrine and deflecting blame. We’ll dissect the jury’s likely reaction, analyze her emotional manipulation tactics, and show you exactly how this trial is already setting the stage for what comes next. If you’ve followed Lori’s story since the beginning, you’ll recognize the signs: the performance has begun.

episodes.title: Miracle in Maricopa, Lori Daybell Murder Trial | Profiling Evil
episodes.description:
Lori Vallow Daybell—convicted child killer and alleged Arizona conspirator—showed up to court today in a wheelchair claiming she was too sick to proceed. But just hours later? She walked out on her own two feet like nothing ever happened. In this episode of Profiling Evil, we break down the courtroom drama, the judge’s no-nonsense response, and the eerie parallels to Ferris Bueller’s Day Off. But unlike Ferris, Lori’s not skipping class—she’s on trial for conspiracy to commit murder. Join me as we unpack the manipulation, the psychology, and why this performance might cost her everything. And let’s not forget who this is really about—Brandon Boudreaux, the man she’s accused of trying to kill.

episodes.title: Polygamist Pyramids, Saloons & Ghost Towns | Utah’s Hidden History & Outlaws | Profiling Evil
episodes.description:
Join me on a journey through the Utah desert near the Nevada border, where I revisit some of the polygamist communities I investigated during my time at the Utah Attorney General’s Office. First stop—Modena, a once-thriving railroad town turned ghost town, home to the Righteous Branch polygamist group—also known as The Pyramid Group for their unique pyramid-shaped temple hidden deep in the desert. From there, I ventured 25 miles north to the abandoned gold rush town of Stateline, once teeming with miners, cattle rustlers, and outlaws like Nate Hansen, who met his fate at the hands of a vigilante posse. Today, the wild horses, crumbling saloons, and old mines are all that remain of this Old West ghost town. If you're ever in southwest Utah along the Nevada border, you won’t want to miss these haunted and historic locations!

episodes.title: Cult Member Trained to Obey, Punished for Complying | Profiling Evil
episodes.description:
The story of Moretta Johnson raises a difficult question: Can someone be both a victim and a perpetrator? Johnson, a child bride of FLDS cult leader Samuel Bateman, was sentenced for her role in the abduction of children from state custody. But at just 19, was she truly responsible for her actions—or was she simply following the only reality she had ever known? This case forces us to examine the disturbing ways cults shape their followers, turning the abused into abusers. episodes.title: Living in a Gothic Cult: w/Author Nicole Lowe McBride | PODCAST | Profiling Evil
episodes.description:
Nicole Lowe McBride lived on the streets from ages thirteen to sixteen. She faced many of the challenges homeless youth still face today including dropping out of school, drugs, inappropriate sexual advances, hunger, cold, and physical violence. Never Let Me Go is the story of how she went from vagrant to attorney. Nicole became addicted to hallucinogenic drugs and found herself tangled in gothic cult on the streets of Salt Lake City, Utah. She escaped physical and sexual violence when she fled Salt Lake with another runaway teen ending up on the streets of San Franscico. Nicole’s belief in her fantasy world, propagated by the gothic cult, was upended as she hitchhiked with her new companions selling and using drugs and trying to survive.

 At age sixteen, Nicole found herself back in Salt Lake and pregnant without much of a future for herself or her unborn child. When she first held her son, it changed her life and with his love she reclaimed her determination and will to survive. With only three credits toward her high school diploma, she returned to school and began to dream about the future they could have together.  

 As a single parent, Nicole graduated high school and entered college ultimately receiving her law degree from the S.J. Quinney College of Law at the University of Utah in 2008. Throughout her story, Nicole interlaces her experience as an assistant attorney general in the child protection division representing the Division of Child and Family Services in child welfare cases. Nicole’s experiences as a teen parallels many of the struggles she sees in the lives of parents in the child welfare system. As an attorney, she has dedicated her career to helping these families and her book is a testament to the tenacity of the human spirit.

episodes.title: Cult Expert Dr.Janja Lalich , Cult Survivor Andrea Lithgow | CHOIR PRACTICE #26 | Profiling Evil
episodes.description:
Cults, what are they and how to they recruit? Join us for a fascinating discussion on cults with cult expert Dr. Janja Lalich she is also joined by cult survivor Andrea Lithgow. 

We will be talking about different types of cults from Daybell/Vallow to the Zion Society. 

Dr. Janja Lalich

Janja Lalich, Ph.D. is a researcher, author, and educator specializing in cults and extremist groups, with a particular focus on charismatic relationships, political and other social movements, ideology and social control, and issues of gender and sexuality. She has been a consultant to educational, mental health, business, media, and legal professionals, as well as having worked with current members, former members, and families of members of controversial groups.

Janja's books: 
https://www.amazon.com/Janja-Lalich/e/B000APU23K%3Fref=dbs_a_mng_rwt_scns_share

Janja has appeared recently in documentaries such as:
HBOMAX Heaven's Gate: The Cult of Cult
STARZ Seduced: Inside the NXIVM Cult

Andrea Lithgow recounts what it was like to grow up in a religious cult and how she was able to leave. 

https://dandyjewelry.com/
